snippet: Israeli officials have remained quiet in public about the bloodshed, but see the Egyptian military and a secular government as in Israel’s best interests.
abstract: Israeli officials have remained quiet in public about the bloodshed in Egypt, but see Egyptian military and secular government as in Israel’s best interests; country's main interest is stable Egypt that can preserve 1979 peace treaty and restore order along border in lawless Sinai Peninsula.

byline.contributor: Nayef Hashlamoun contributed reporting from Hebron, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Israeli officials have remained quiet in public about the bloodshed, but see the Egyptian military and a secular government as in Israel’s best interests.

headline.main: Israel Keeps a Wary Eye on Turmoil in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Israel Keeps a Wary Eye on Turmoil in Egypt

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
